definition: to answer/to reply/Reply to: (in email header)
reply/answer/return/respond/echo
to answer/to agree
to cover/to overflow/to overturn/to capsize
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter

sentences.english: The interviewer spends a lot of time answering your questions.
sentences.chinese: 面試官花大批時間答覆你的問題。

sentences.english: To this the unthinking will give an off-hand answer .
sentences.chinese: 給我一個直截了當的答覆。

sentences.english: I'll gie you a definite answer tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天我將給你一個確切答覆。

sentences.english: He neglected to reply to the invitation.
sentences.chinese: 他忘記封那邀請作答覆。

sentences.english: I am breathing in Thy answers, Stilling every doubt and fear.
sentences.chinese: 我今呼入你的答覆，平靜疑惑和驚恐。

sentences.english: Until now it has met with no response. (See "Talks, first" page 48 report 77).
sentences.chinese: 到目前爲止，它沒有收到答覆見面。

sentences.english: We demanded that they give us a definite answer.
sentences.chinese: 我們要求他們給個確切的答覆。

sentences.english: Should you have any questions please let us know.
sentences.chinese: 我們等待您的即刻答覆。

sentences.english: They have not understood a word of his fevered reply.
sentences.chinese: 他們不理解一個詞，他發燒的答覆。

sentences.english: If you don't receive an answer quickly, give them a prod.
sentences.chinese: 你要是不能很快得到答覆，不妨催他們一下。

sentences.english: B: Let me take a look at the schedule first. I'll get back to you this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 我先看一下時間表，下午答覆你。

sentences.english: Funds should respond to the inquiry of donators faithfully and in time.
sentences.chinese: 對於捐贈人的查詢，基金會應當及時如實答覆。

sentences.english: Not very far, the National Academy members I’m sure would have you believe.
sentences.chinese: 的確不能，我想美國科學院院士給你滿意答覆的。

sentences.english: A:Well,I'll sleep on it and give you my answer tommorrow afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，我再考慮一下，明天下午給你答覆。

sentences.english: Danielle: I might have to get back to you.
sentences.chinese: 丹妮爾:我要晚點才能答覆你。

sentences.english: I can give you my answer tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 讓我想一想，明天給你答覆。

definition: to reply/to recover/variant of 回復|回复[hui2 fu4]
variant of 複述|复述[fu4 shu4]
to solicit/to seek/to request (opinions, feedback etc)/to petition
to offer excuses (colloquial)/to stall
ultimatum
to reveal the truth/to spill the beans
after the event/in hindsight/in retrospect
as for/as to/to go so far as to
to answer/to respond/to converse
to use as an excuse/on the pretext/excuse/pretext/also written 借口[jie4 kou3]
variant of 嬭|奶[nai3]
you (female)/variant of 你[ni3]
straightforward/clear-cut/blunt (e.g. statement)/you might as well/simply
to catch and hold on/to continue/to go on to do sth/to follow/to carry on/then/after that/subsequently/to proceed/to ensue/in turn/in one's turn
to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
to report (to one's superior)
to refuse to meet sb/to avoid sb
